intro: Machaerina anceps, commonly known as the New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, spindly growth habit. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by long, slender pods. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Machaerina anceps is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and plays a role in local ecosystems.
